main event: An object resembling a weather balloon was observed moving through the sky in southwest Canada.
interesting points: The object was initially about 1/3 or more of the apparent size of the full moon.
The object was observed to be stationary for several periods, with jerky and indefinable motion through the sky.
The object was observed through 10x50 binoculars by two witnesses while driving on Highway 97.
The location and time indicate there is probably no astronomical explanation for the object.
The jerky, indefinable motion is probably not characteristic of a satellite or other known astronomical object.
sighted object: an object resembling a weather balloon
witnesses: 2 witnesses in a car on Highway 97
